link.value: ACTOP: Ancient Construct Tower of Philosopher

item.description:
It is the final stage of the 9th five-year plan and the oblast Odusad is still behind the expectations of the State Committee for Agriculture. After poor harvests in the prior years things finally look better and the comrades are looking forward to a bountiful harvest. The pumpkins are tall as tractor wheels and the flowers smell sweeter than ever. If only those pesky weeds will not spoil everything. The head of the Kolkhoz “Druzhba” has proclaimed the “Operation: Dandelion” in order to get rid of the weeds before they completely take over the farm.
All the comrades will have to work together if they want to save the harvest and fulfill the five-year plan. It will be challenging, but it can be done!

Operation: Dandelion is a light-weight cooperative family board game. 
It is played over 5 rounds. During each round additional weed tokens will be placed onto the Farm Tiles while the players will move around and clear the fields from these weeds. They have only a limited number of actions available and as the game progresses it becomes more and more challenging to keep the weeds under control. Farm Tiles can be overgrown, the oblast government might send additional support and the players can work overtime – but will it be enough?

item.description:
You and your friends are tired of having all your great stuff go missing. You know it's that creepy house on the corner, and you have had enough. You are each going to gather a group of friends from the neighborhood and make a mad dash into the house to try to get your items back.

To start The Kids vs. The House, players determine how many items — as few as one and up to twenty — they need to recover from the house. This allows them to customize the length of their game.

You then flip the fist item card over and see how many kid team points you need to have to try to get the item back.

Each player starts with two cards from the Action/Kid deck. This deck contains kids from the neighborhood worth 1-5 points each that you add to your hand to try to build up a team with enough points to retrieve the item. There are also four other types of cards that cause things, do things, and help protect you from the creepy things that can happen in the house:


 Chaos cards always go off when drawn. Chaos she is a harsh mistress.
 Protection cards are used to prevent or deflect many of the negative events and actions in the game.
 Incident cards can be played on other players during your action phase to try to disrupt their chances of acquiring the item.
 Trap cards always go off when drawn, with the house apparently trying to defend its ill-gotten gains. Beware the house!


During your turn, you draw a card from the Action/Kid deck. If it doesn't instruct you to play it immediately (traps and chaos cards), then you can put it in your hand. You then have the option to perform an action. If you have a card that is playable (Incident and some Chaos), you can play this on the other players to help yourself or hurt their chances to win.

Turns proceed around the play area until someone has at least as many points in their hand as shown as the target number on the item. Once that minimum is met, they can choose to fold their hand and place it face down. They now cannot be targeted by any incidents, but can be affected by Chaos and Trap cards.

Once a person folds, everyone yet to play in that round draws one card, then everyone reveals their cards to see who has the most points and clams the item.

If this wasn't the final item, shuffle the cards and repeat with the next item. When the final item is claimed, the person with the most points at the end wins.

---
We currently are planning a Kickstarter launch in August 2016

link.value: Card Games: Draw and Discard Games

item.description: Nie Tej! is a traditional card game, very popular in PoznaÅ„, based on memory and bluff. It consists of 55 colorful cards and instruction with a mini-dictionary of PoznaÅ„ dialect.

A village-building card game set in the world of Valeria. Establish resources, construct buildings, and attract adventurers to your Village to be crowned the next capitol city.

Each player takes a turn taking one action from the following list and all other players may follow the action but with fewer rewards:

Tax: Take 1 Gold and Draw 1 Card. (Follow: Draw 1 card.)
Harvest: Draw 3 Cards. (Follow: Draw 1 card.)
Develop: Discard 1 card to add a Resource to your village. (Follow: Discard 2 cards to add a Resource to your village.)
Build: Add a building to your village. Draw a card. (Follow: Add a building to your village, but do not draw a card.)
Recruit: Pay 1 Gold to add an Adventurer to your village. (Follow: Pay 2 Gold to add an Adventurer to your village.)

Building cards can be used for 2 reasons. 1) Pay resources to add it to your village as a building and gain its benefit and VP. 2) Develop it as a Resource and place it under your Castle card.

When building, use resources you have developed or pay another player 1 Gold to use their resource.

The game ends when a player has built or recruited 10 buildings/Adventurers.

item.description:
The Magic Shop is a game of magical, mercantile mayhem! Players each assume the role of a wizard or witch running their own magic shop, using ingredient cards to to concoct potions, talismans, scrolls, and magical weapons and armor with the help of your apprentices. Apprentices are sent into the market to gather magical ingredients and advertise to potential customers, or you may have some stay in the lab to help with the work of enchanting.

Ingredient cards are placed into your "cauldron" to produce a dice pool. This dice pool is then rolled in an attempt to complete enchantment lines (sets of specific dice facings). Players may opt to try and add more dice to their cauldrons to complete additional lines to make their items more valuable, but risk drawing magical accident cards that may make their apprentices vanish, curse the item, or turn some of your hard-earned gold into lead.

Cast spells to help you in your endeavors by having an apprentice visit the caster's tower, or hex your opponents to give you an edge in your quest to be the greatest magic shop owner in the city.

Try to anticipate your customers' needs when they arrive and sell them as many of your finished items as possible and pave the way to your victory! Victory Points are earned primarily by making the most gold selling your enchantments, but victory points may also be earned from completing all enchantment lines on a magic item. Points may be lost if your items end up cursed. The wizard or witch with the highest number of victory points at the end of eight turns is considered the winner.

Elemental Conflux is a game of dueling elements.

Each player summons elemental creatures to the battlefield to fight for dominance over five elemental nodes. Players create five stacks of creatures that will do battle, with the highest strength totals winning the battle.

Spells and certain powerful entities will make combat interesting and exciting. Summoners conjure additional creatures to their stack, Elemental Lords reduce the strength of the opposing elements' stacks, mighty dragons win no matter how many creatures oppose it (but can be thwarted by a wish from a Djinn) and cunning Wizards will very literally mix things up!

Cast spells to turn the tide of battle. Fires of destruction might rain down, eliminating cards from your opponent's stack, a divination will allow you to peak at your opponents stack before battle is resolved, or a mighty whirlwind might scatter creatures into each others stacks.

Battles commence, and the player with at least three out of five winning stacks takes control of one of five Elemental nodes. The player who takes control of at least three out of five elemental nodes wins the game.

link.value: Elemental Conflux: Pointy Hat Spell Promo Card

item.description:
Ladrones ("Thieves") is a party-game, created by David Vaquero, easy to learn and very funny to play. In this game, 2 to 5 players fight each other for being the best white collar thief.

The players will try to form a band of specialist in some criminal skills, like strong-box opening or server hacking, to perform the most risky robberys. They could draw cards from the deck or place the highest bid to form their crew.

When a player is ready to carry out a robbery, he will announce it and will replace its specialist cards by the respective color specialist dices. The player will have only 30 seconds to get the perfect combination in any dice by throwing them as many times as necessary.

After the assault, it doesn't matter if the player has had success or not, it's time to go out and run. The player will have another 30 seconds to throw the Driver's dice to left behind the police and scape.

The game will finish when all the plans of robbery run out or all the available diamonds have gone. The player who has the biggest diamond amount is the winner.

A puzzle in the round, an obstacle course on a roll. 360 degrees of orbital track filled with mind bending turns, brain-thrilling twists and jaw-dropping stunts that will challenge you, inspire you and have you wondering how can something so easy to pick up, be so hard to put down! There are 115 steps to beat this maze game.

item.description:
Pani-High! is a card game in which players scramble for twelve Place cards. When the deck runs out, the player who obtained the most Place cards will be the winner.

Game play
Sum up the points of the Combat cards played by 2 players. Player with higher points will be the winner. 
The point of this game is that after the match with the Combat cards, the losing player's Combat cards will be discarded, and the other Combat cards return to the hand of the player who won the battle.

To win the battle, you must also place the large number against other player.

However, in such a case, the winner's deck of cards will be exposed and remembered by other players, which will be disadvantage for next rounds of the game.

MOVIE : https://youtu.be/1WHRnpZgUuw

item.description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μÏŒνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεá¿–ν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from London's highest viewing platform.

A monopoly (from Greek monos μÏŒνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεá¿–ν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Servcorp, a multinational organisation that sells serviced office space, virtual office products and IT services.

With a system of dynamic and entertaining auction, players will have to manage their assets and serve the military power of their opponents to get new cards resources, troops and win the coveted points.

-

Espada Negra es un juego de cartas ambientado en las tierras de Dormenia en el que los jugadores controlarán a una poderosa familia del reino. Con un sistema de subastas dinámico y entretenido, los jugadores tendrán que gestionar sus bienes y atender al poder militar de sus oponentes para conseguir nuevas cartas de recursos, tropas y los ansiados puntos de victoria.

item.description:
Defeat your friends to win honor become Master of the DOJO! Choose a fighting style, build your character, and crush the competition!

Dojo is a fast paced, martial arts, card-drafting, character building contest of smashing your friends and trying to earn HONOR from the MASTERS of the DOJO.

Choose a Fighting Style with unique abilities and advance down the Fire or Water path.

Training Phase: Do Drills to improve your basic stats; Strength, Dexterity, and Chi. Study Techniques, which can be used multiple times during combat but expend your energy. You may also plan Tricks which are one time use and will likely catch your opponents off-guard.

The MASTERS of the DOJO watch over training, and if you please them, they may award you Honor. MASTERS may want you to build up your strength, and others prefer tricks!

Sparring Phase: Use the tricks, techniques, and drills that you've learned to take on your opponents in head-to-head or group combat. You can additionally use the abilities granted by your Fighting Style.

When Sparring begins, the combatants "Size-Up" each other, betting energy to see who will get the first strike.

Every opponent you knock out will earn you Honor and bring you one step closer to becoming MASTER OF THE DOJO!

item.description:
Nation is a great game of tactics and military strategies where the diplomacy and the ruse of each player take precedence over the chance and the stroke of luck.

The object of the game is to build 1 capital and 10 headquarters.
Each player starts with a Capital, represented by a hexagon with a star.

The game is played in turns:
1- Raising army
2- Moving armies
3- Fighting
4- Building headquarters

The Capital and headquarters are providing movement and force points (1 each to a limit of 6).

Movement points are used to move pieces (tanks, ships and fighters).

Force points are the force of a unit (including Capital and HQ) have to attack or defend. Units can be combined from adjacent hex, the force with the higher points total win, the defeated force must retreat according to specific rules. If a unit cannot retreat it is destroyed (Capital and HQ cannot retreat)

HQ are constructed if a player has at least one tank on a city hex.

A monopoly (from Greek monos μÏŒνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεá¿–ν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from, an US company, known for favorite hand tools, power tools, tool storage products, specialty tools...

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Nördlingen, a city in Germany.

A monopoly (from Greek monos μÏŒνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεá¿–ν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements of Donauwörth, in Germany.

A children's game in which you have just finished school, and you have to go back home with the least possible distractions. The game teaches children some basic principles about life. The game play is just roll and move.

Crusher is a fantasy trading card game that can be played with various deck sizes: A Skirmish game involves no deck, just a starting hand of 7 cards. A Clash game uses 20-card decks. A Battle game uses 40-card decks. A War game uses 100-card decks.

Two players exchange attacks using character cards and booster cards played out of hand. The object is to eliminate all of your opponent's characters in hand while that opponent lacks the ability to draw more characters from the deck.

Cards of Cthulhu a deck building game is centered around the Lovecraft genre which Cthulhu is famously known by.

In the game you will compete to build a better deck than the other investigators, defeat Ancient Ones, all the while not going insane.

Cards of Cthulhu is a deckbuilding game where you and up to 4 other players each strive to build the best deck, called your library and score as many victory points in order to win the game. Each player starts the game with the same library, 7 Strengths and 3 Fears. Players shuffle the library and deal themselves 5 cards. Each Strength is worth 1 power. Fears are worth nothing. The opening hand can have from 2 to 5 points of power. The main deck of cards is then dealt 5 cards out to the Storyboard. If any events happen, do what the card says, otherwise, check for card's with surprise effects (which usually add to your insanity). Now the first player takes their turn. They can use their hand of cards to buy items from the storyboard based on their cost (and, in the case of Horrors, the insanity level to banish them). Non-horror cards are placed in that player's graveyard, Horror cards are banished to the banished stack. At the end of the turn, the player draws their five cards again, if the library lacks sufficient cards, shuffle the graveyard back in to the library and complete the rest of the five card draw. The play is passed on to the next player, who then refills the storyboard from the main deck of any cards that were purchased or banished by the prior player. Resolves and event and surprise effects and then their turn starts.

Insanity rules - In the game, it is very important to track just how insane you are! Everyone starts out totally normal - with zero insanity - event, surprise effects and using certain arcane or artifacts will increase or decrease your insanity. If you reach 13 insanity, you have crossed over and succumbed to insanity. At this point, the only way to reduce your insanity is playing cards that reduce your insanity or discarding cards to reduce your insanity by the Victory Point value of the card. You'll need to do this as soon as possible because if your reach 20, you've completely lost your mind and are a vassal for the Ancient Ones (or, in game terms, you just lost and are out of the game).

Ancient Ones - Before the game is started, you separate the Ancient Ones, Azathoth, Hastur and Cthulhu are shuffled and put on the bottom of the stack. Yig is taken out and the rest are shuffled and put on top of the stack. Then Yig is placed face up on the stack. While the Ancient Ones are face up on the stack, they have an effect, called The Haunting - which impacts the game. Yig, for example, cost 8 points to defeat, however, his haunting effect is that, for each two banished Horrors, Yig costs 1 more point to defeat. If three Horrors are banished, Yig would cost 9 points to defeat. When a new ancient one is revealed from the stack, which happens after one has been defeated, they have a one time "awakening" attack - this is an effect that happens immediately when they are turned face up and the attack is against each player. If the player has a defense, they can defend against the attack - if allowed. For example, Ithaqua's Awakening Attack is that each player puts all Allies from their graveyard back in to the story.

Psychic Blast - These cards are put in a stack outside of the main deck or the Ancient One's. They cost three points and can be purchased at anytime during your turn. Sometimes the storyboard will contain cards you don't want or can't buy and you can always buy a Psychic Blast if you would like. When a Psychic Blast is destroyed, it is placed in the destroyed pile. If the stack is empty, no more Psychic blasts can be purchased.

Corruption - These cards are put in a stack outside of the main deck or the Ancient One's. Card effects that say you gain a corruption are from this stack of cards. Corruptions are have a -1 victory point, which, costs you points at the end of the game if they are in your library. When a Corruption is destroyed, it is returned to the corruption stack. If the corruption stack is empty, no more corruptions can be handed out to players.

Investigators - Each player represents an investigator, a Gangster, Law Enforcement, Nun, Priest, Private Investigator, Professor or Psychic. Each investigator has a special ability that allows them to do their special thing during their turns. The Psychic's ability allow that player - at the beginning of their turn, to look at the top two cards of their deck and then put one of those cards in the graveyard. Most of the time, this will help the player select the best of the two cards, possibly discarding a card they would rather not draw, sometimes both cards would work very well, but they still have to discard one. Other abilities affect the cards drawn, power of cards, the storyboard and so on.

name.value: Ground Pounders: The STAR CORPS Card Game

item.description:
From the publisher's website:

Ground Pounders is a card game of STAR CORPS combat. It simulates the battles of the Corporate-Colonial Wars of the late 22nd Century. It simulates those battles on a scale much larger than the STAR CORPS miniatures rules normally allow, with most Force Cards representing a Company (which is 4-10 squads).

User description
The game is played with large Force Cards face up in front of each player. Each Force Card has both a Victory Point and Hit Point value. Once enough damage has been done to a card to equal or exceed it's Hit Points, the unit is eliminated and the player who eliminated it gains it's Victory Point value.

The players are also dealt a hand of smaller Action Cards which are not revealed when dealt. Action Cards are generally played to inflict damage to enemy units, although some activate other effects such as healing friendly units or allowing a player to draw additional cards.

Games may be played either until a player has reached a set Victory Point total, or until only one player has units remaining.
The PinBox 3000 is a cardboard, assembly-required, customizable, modular arcade "art-cade" system of tabletop pinball, and gravity-powered games.

Cards are placed center of table, stacked, face down.
Each card has four of these numbers on it (1,2,3,4,5,6,7,8,9)

First player calls a number, turns over top card, reads number.
If number called is one of four digits on card, player keeps it.
Otherwise it is placed faced down on bottom of main pile.
Next player does the same procedure, and so on.

When all cards are taken, he who has the most wins.

The Trials of Idavare is a card-based party game for 9–27 players. Join a fierce battle of truth and deception, a battle of conviction that threatens your very life. As your faction struggles to claim Idavare, well-chosen words are more precious than any card dealt, and a single misstep can mean certain death. Victory depends on your ability to debate, lie, reason, and – should the night call you – move silently...

In The Trials of Idavare, every player secretly receives a faction card and a skill card. At night, the evil, sneaky werewolves transform into beast form and take a villager's life. During the day, the villagers must determine who is a creature of the night and hang them before the last one of the innocent is inside a werewolf's belly. Besides their senses and wits, some villagers have useful skills at their disposal that might help in battle – just pray the skill is not used by a werewolf...
You say a phrase and the others have to guess what you are saying. Too simple? No, because you have to poke your tongue out or bite on your tongue or ... during talking.

item.description:
The goal of the game is to filled all the values on a pyramide using dice compbinations.

By throwing 3 die, choose 2 and add them up or multiply them up. Find the result on the pyramid and put a token on it. You must start by the bottom of the pyramid and climb up.

You get 3 wild values that you can use during a game to place a additional token on a vlaue of your choice (it must be a valid choice from the bottom to the top).

You get 3 chances to pick an unused dice from an opponent during the game.

name.value: Saban's Adventures of Oliver Twist: Das große Spiel

item.description:
You roll a dice, select a direction and move this number of fields. You try to reach one of the adventure fields, which allows you to challenge one of your opponents. The winner gets one chip. If you go on a field, on which an other player is standing, you can steel a chip from them.
The first, who has 7 chips wins.

name.value: Gute Zeiten Schlechte Zeiten: Das Spiel

item.description: You roll a dice and move your character as many fields on the board. The field, you reach tells you which kind of challange eg drawing, acting, you have to fulfill. The first, who has 15 points wins.

This is a game for 2 players.
Each Player has pawns in 4 Colors (1 Player large pawns the other small).
Each player has start fields for his pawns on one of the sides of the board. The players start regions are on the opponent sides of the board.
All fields are connected with horizontal and vertical lines.
The fields are colored (1 of the 4 colors of the pawns) or black.
On Players turn he can move 1 pawn in one direction as far as he wants and no other pawn is on the way.
The pawn can be moved on the position of an opponent pawn. This opponent pawn is out of the game.
Independent of this if a pawn is now on a colored field the opponent is only allowed to move the pawn with this Color in his next turn. If the player has choosen a black field the opponent may choose any of his pawns.
The player who cannot move the allowed pawn in his turn looses.

name.value: Gute Zeiten Schlechte Zeiten: Das Spiel zur Serie

item.description:
The game is based on the German TV series "Gute Zeiten Schlechte Zeiten".
The whole game board has square fields like a chess board.
There are additional drawn walls which separate parts of the boards from each other (rooms). The lines have spaces where the rooms are linked (doors).
There are 20 differnt pawns representing each a different character of the TV series.
At the begin of the game, each player gets 2 cards of the character stock, showing each 1 character/pawn and a room Card showing 1 room.
The player who is first to get his 2 character in the room of his room card wins.
On players turn he rolls 2 dice and moves 1 character for each of the die the number shown. Movement is allowed horizontal, vertical and diagonal also with changing while moving. Moving through walls is not allowed.
One of the oppenents (the fasted) may say which charcter is owned by the actual user. If this is right the Player has to show this character card and has only 1 die and 1 move in his next turns.
If the opponent is wrong, he has to show one of his character cards with the same effect. If a player has to Show his second card, he looses and is out of the game.
The game can also end if only 1 player is in the game. This player has won the game.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from NASPL, stands for The North American Association of State and Provincial Lotteries

It's a dominio game where children should learn about the stories of the bible and there "historic" series.
The start stone shows the Genesis. The activ player tries to find the next matching Stone/story from all stones which lie open in the middle of the table.
The game should lead the children asking questions about the bible stories, which main content are discribed in little books in the game.
There are Stones allowing to continue different bible series in different directions.
All Player win when they can finish the stories.

This game is an auction that should not be a successful bid.
Exhibit of this auction is Rubbish.
Players have participated for appearance.

All players will sealed bid against Rubbish in order.
The successful bid was the player to bid the Rubbish, and then deducted the bid amount from the honor points.
Lowest price of the player will get the rights of the next of auctioneer.
All of the other players will be added points the bid amount of money to honor points.

Seven of Rubbish is the end of the game at the time has been a successful bid.

In fact, all of the players, has been assigned the role of a secret at the start of the game.
Rubbish that has been written on the role of the secret will be bonus points.
And honor points, the sum of the bonus point of Rubbish, the highest person is the winner.

name.value: Die Sendung mit der Maus: Was passt dazu?

item.description:
The game persists of 7 panels in different colors, which show the 'Maus' in different situations and 7 cards of each color with suitable items . One card of each color is put on the corresponding panel, the others cards are shuffled and build a stock. The players have time to memory the items on the panels, then the cards are turned facedown.
The topmost card of the stock is taken and shown to all players. The first player, who says which hidden item is laying on the panel of the same color as the card drawn, gets the memorized card and the new card is put on the panel facedown.
The game ends if the stock is empty, the player with the most cards wins.

This is a trivia game about dangerous situations in life.
The game board shows 6 situations where a person behaves wrong.
Each player gets a puzzle of 6 pieces which shows one of the situations on the board, but with the right behavior.
This is the counter, how many questions each player has answered right.
On players turn he gets a question from a card deck about dangerous situations in life and how to behave right in this situation. With each question answered right the player places one of his puzzle pieces on the board. Who places first all 6 wins the game.

name.value: Der König der Löwen: Das löwenstarke Familienspiel

item.description:
The cards are put on the suitable fields on the board. You roll a dice and move your pawn as many fields, fields with no card or an other player on it do not count. You take the card your move ends on and take the corresponding action.
 The game persists of 3 chapters, Simba as a child in the steppe, as a teen in the jungle and as an adult at Pride Rock, fighting against Scar.
You can leave the steppe after you have found 3 pairs of animals, you can leave the jungle if you own 3 particular cards. At Pride Rock you have to find 3 cards with a lightning on it and then reach the scar field with the exact number on the dice.

A monopoly (from Greek monos μÏŒνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεá¿–ν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements about offshore technonogies. Version is equipped with elements of the oil and gas industry, including tokens revamped to include a helicopter, drill bits, safety helmet, scuba diver and a remotely operated vehicle.

name.value: Monopoly: Rotary Club of Mount Isa South West

item.description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μÏŒνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεá¿–ν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. Doctor Who CLUE places your favorite characters on a search through the Universe to rescue The Doctor. Playing as his closest friends and allies, players must reveal who amongst them the Daleks conditioned and mind-controlled to mislead the Doctor, what powerful weapon was used in the crime, and where The Doctor has been taken in the kidnapping, thereby saving him from the Daleks!

"Standard" Clue cards that this version shares include:

6 Suspect Cards: Amy & Rory, Commander Strax, Madame Vastra, Clara Oswald, Jenny, River Song

6 Weapon Cards: Hallucinogenic Lipstick, Clara Cyberman Gun, Vortex Manipulator, Strax's Gun, Sonic Screwdriver, and The Moment

9 Location Cards: Platform One, The Moon, Gallifrey, Skaro, Trenzalore, The Library, Starship UK, Demon's Run, Victorian London

In addition to the above common components, the game features a few slight variations from standard CLUE:

 Rules for 2 player games are included in the game rulebook
 Each of the player characters also include special abilities
 This version also includes cards for a theme-specific variant in the form of 21 "Intrigue" cards, 13 of which grant players special abilities, and 8 of which are 'pocketwatch' cards that may potentially end the game.

name.value: Monopoly: Chrysler Town & Country Road Trip Edition

item.description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μÏŒνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεá¿–ν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Chrysler, a multinational car company.

ãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ã‚¢ã‚¨ãƒ ãƒ–ãƒ¬ãƒ ï¼ï¼ˆã‚µã‚¤ãƒ•ã‚¡ãƒ¼ï¼‰ ("Fire Emblem 0 (Cipher)") is a collectible card game based on the Fire Emblem video games. Currently, it is being released in Japan.

Both players choose one main character at the start of the game. All the cards in the game are character cards. Each character has a base attack strenght, as well as support strength (in addition to certain other powers and abilities). Each player has five 'orbs' ('life' represented by cards'), which the other player tries to get down to zero by attacking the main character.

There's five phases in a game.
1) Starting Phase
Untapping tapped characters, and drawing 1 card.
2) The Bond Phase
Playing 1 card into the ´bond´ area. Each card has a value (top left). The value of cards in the 'bond' area determines the value of the characters you can put into play.
3) The Sortie Phase
Play characters, or level up certain characters. The characters you can play depends on their card value and the value of cards in your ´bond´ area.
4) The Action Phase
Move your characters into the opponent's area; attack your opponent's characters; or use a skll.
5) The Final Phase
Skills that say 'during this turn' end, and the turn goes to the opposing player.

The goal of the game is to defeat your opponent's main character by destroying his 'orbs.'

It's magic school's graduation season.
You are one of apprentice witches and to pass final exam to become a respectable witch.
The contents of the test is to make a comfortable village to live for your familiars!
While collecting the wealth of the forest, you will build magical tree houses.
Let's build the tree houses more and higher.

The game based on card-drafting in real time.
In the planning phase, you will gather planning documents(cards) to your drawer and can occasionally use magic to influence other players.
Then you can build magical houses in your village by setting these documents in the construction phase.
Your familiars can sometimes help you to keep resources in the forest. This may be important for earning more VPs at the end of the game.
After repeating 4 rounds of this, you will gain VPs from your buildings, the ability of those and the challenges that you could achieve.
The player with the most VPs wins the game!

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. Perfect combination of the classics "Loco Lingo" and "Mau Mau" - fostering language skills, vocabulary and creativity - for creative storytellers.

Players play cards, some of them with special effects, and use their drawing to tell a story. You need to play cards with the same colour or drawing of the first one, and utilize special effects to change the colour, to play two cards or to loose cards being the first catching the witch. The player that loose all their cards creates an end of the story and wins.

Siggils are magical seals where spirits are locked. The players must untie a Siggil and capture the spirits that are escaping!

Siggil is a card game for 1 to 4 players that contains seven families of seven cards numbered 1 to 7 and seven unique spirits cards, each associated with a family and a number. All cards are thoroughly shuffled, including spirits, then placed level-by-level, overlapping face down and face up, according to a simple form called a Siggil. The game includes description to build several Siggils like: The Pass, The Turtle or The Pyramids.

On his turn, a player draws a card from the Siggil and takes it in his hand. When a spirit escapes the Siggil, players can capture it by playing the right combination of cards from their hands. The winner is the first player who controls more spirits than the others at the end of the game.

Siggil also includes rules for a solitary game.

item.description:
A pick-up and delivery game based on Atlantic Trade in the 17th Century. The object of the game is to ship cargo from port to port in exchange for victory points; the first to 25 victory points wins.

During your turn you draw 2 cards from the deck, move each of your ships a maximum of 5 spaces, and play any number of cards. You can also load or unload cargo at port. When the turn ends battles are resolved with a roll of the dice.

There are many different types of cards in the deck to keep the game fun and exciting. Wind cards allow you to increase ship movement. Battle cards increase your odds in battle, or can be used to escape battle altogether. There are also wild cards which allow you to adjust the value of the cargo, or summon pirates to attack an opponent.

item.description:
The main idea is, NATO devolves toward operational ineffectiveness and, on that basis, old Vladimir decides to try for the big solution to get back all the former Soviet Union's western borderlands.

In designing the game (already done despite the long wait for its publication), I came up with a new system that emphasizes the following perspective: today's First World militaries are part way through a systemic transformation broadly comparable to the one they went through during the 1930s.

The issue in the 30s was how to integrate mechanization into what otherwise still remained foot-slogging, horse-drawn armies. The debate centered around how much horse cavalry to keep mixed in with the tanks, trucks and other combat vehicles. The idea was the large mass of unmotorized units would form a "base of maneuver" from which the relatively more scarce -- but elite -- moto-mech units would operate.

Of course, by the war's midpoint all that had been settled. The question had come to center on determining the optimal mix of tracked and wheeled vehicles, etc.

Today, we're witnessing a similar transformation in that the former moto-mech elite has, in effect, taken on the role of the previous era's foot-sloggers and horse cavalry: they're now the new "base of maneuver" element, holding the line while, evolving atop and past them, is the new elite: the special forces, which are themselves increasingly robot-equipped.

Given that the cost and social advantages involved in deploying small elites rather than the mass mechanized armies of the previous era (the draft isn't going to come back), I see us now at about the 1938-equivalent in terms of the new transition.

Aside from that, another characteristic is more and more of the First World's armies combat experience is increasingly contained within the personnel of the SoF. That, of course, further enhances their relative combat power.

To smoothly model all that, I've come up a system I've titled the "Big And Dumb Armies Super System" (BADASS). I'll be using it again.

This design will be appearing in Modern War issue number 29 (May-June 2017).

item.description:
Central City: Heroes is a cooperative board game for 1-4 players. Each player takes on the role of a unique Superhero with their own unique powers. Players work together to battle minions, complete missions, recruit other heroes, and unlock their upgrade cards. This will all lead up to the final showdown with the Superhero's Nemesis. The Players must complete five missions and defeat the Nemesis in order to win the game. Heroes will accomplish these things by moving around and exploring Central City.

The board consists of 16 interchangeable location hex tiles that make up Central City. Every time you play the city itself will change.

Players will begin by creating their characters. To do so they will get a Superhero Player Board, a Super Power Card and a Secret Identity Card. Combining the Hero Board with the Super Power Card will create the Player's Hero Persona. With 6 Player Characters and 12 Super Power Cards, there are 72 different Hero Personas in the Central City: Heroes Core Set. The Players will also receive their own Secret Identity Card which the game will be trying to force players to reveal.

Are you ready to become a guardian of Central City?

User summary

A standalone expansion to Tank Hunter (Jäger) 2e.

Tank Hunter is set in a fictional future where players pit their army of model tanks against each other. Each player has a small unit of various tanks from WW2, and deploy them against each other trying to defeat the other player's tanks, infantries and guns.

Commander contains more tanks, more infantry and more guns, and adds Commander cards. It can both be played as a standalone game or integrated with the base set, or Jäger.

Milan, early 20th century, the city is in turmoil as more than 200 new buildings are rushed to being completed in time for welcoming the best minds of the planet. The 1906 Universal Exposition is approaching and, as one of the 40 exhibiting nations, you are confident that your engineers and scientists will impress the world. Who will exhibit the most impressive technological advancements? Which energy source will prevail: the majestic power of Steam or the more elegant and efficient Electricity? Can you prevail in prestige and glory against the other competing nations?

In Expo 1906, players will win by totaling more prestige points at the end of the game than their opponents. Points are awarded for completing Projects which represent historical inventions of the period. To complete a Project, a player must purchase Resources and place them in a proper combinations together with a Project in his Laboratory. This is a challenging task as Projects come in many different shapes and must fit together with their resources in an already tight space. Soon the available room in the Laboratory will reduce and players will face the puzzle solving aspect of the game.
 Strategy plays an important role too: to speed up the completion of a Project players can acquire Technologies, which can either reduce the number of Resources required to complete a Project or enhance the type of actions at their disposal. This will require careful management of the available space in their Laboratory too. Also, by registering ideas at the Patents'Office players can become leader in the development of specific Resources and accumulate more prestige points when completing Projects. Setting priorities between all these actions will become critical as players rush to prepare in time for the upcoming World Exposition.

item.description:
A Hold Birodalma ("The Empire of Moon") is An almost ancient pen-and-paper RPG from Hungary, with modular board, where small cards represent the various locations, such as Towns, Swamps, Cemeteries, Caves, etc. The world's layout always changing ,depending on the players, how they going to place the terrain cards. The box contains a small Event Book, according to the specific terrain, a die roll is needed to deciede what is about to happen in that round with your character. Unfortunately, the games has a very poor design, but a uniqe charm as well, if you're interested in retro games.

Your goal is to kill the Dark Mage in the Black Tower first. Can be played in solo, in a team, or in full competitive mode.

Rolling America, based on the 2014 release Rolling Japan, is a light "multiplayer solitaire" dice game. Each player has a map of the United States that's divided into fifty (abstractly represented) states, which are then bunched together into six differently colored areas.

On a turn, a player draws two regular six-sided dice from a bag and rolls them; the bag starts with seven dice, six matching the colors of the areas on the map along with a wild clear die. All players now write down each number rolled on any state of the matching color, i.e., if the blue die shows 4 and the yellow a 2, write a 4 in one blue state and a 2 in one yellow state. If the clear die is rolled, you can place this number in a state of your choice; additionally, three times per game you can choose to use a non-clear die as any color. However, neighboring states can't have numbers with a difference larger than 1; if you can't place a number without breaking this rule, then you must place an X in a state of the appropriate color. (If all the states in an area are filled, you can ignore the die or use one of your three color changes to place the number elsewhere.)

Rolling America has a few changes from Rolling Japan. The "guard" action allows you to ignore the neighboring number restriction three times during the game, and the "dupe" action allows you to use one of the active dice twice in the same region. As in real life, Alaska and Hawaii are not connected to the continental United States, so you can drop any numbers you want in those states!

After six dice have been rolled, mark one round as being complete, then return the dice to the bag and start the next round. After eight rounds the game ends, and whoever has the fewest Xs on their map wins.

item.description:
Colonial Twilight takes 1 to 2 players into the tangled web of military and political actions comprising the French-Algerian war of 1954-62.

The insurgent Front de Liberation Nationale (FLN), starting from modest beginnings, must build massive and enduring popular support for its cause, and organize to assume power when Algeria finally gains its independence. The Government, representing both the colonial authorities and France’s military leadership, must engage the nationalist insurgency decisively while striving to preserve the support and commitment of the civilian government and society. Players will enter the “heart of darkness” as they use military, political, and economic actions and exploit events to build and maneuver forces to influence or control the population or otherwise achieve their aims along the twisting route to independence.

This latest instalment in GMT’s popular COIN Series system is the first to be designed for two players. You must consider carefully just what you want to do, and how much of it, before the initiative will slip from your fingers. Also, a full solitaire system enables solo players to test their skill against a devious game-run enemy.

From the Casbah to the Aures, are you ready to run the gauntlet?

"Go head-to-head in an exciting game of concealed identities and cunning strategy! Slide your team across the battlefield for a surprise attack! Reveal which bero or villan you're attacking with... then find out whl they're up against! Every character combo yields different outcome. Out-last your opponent to win!"

23 Grey Spacer Tiles create a field similar to Think Fun's Rush Hour puzzle game. 
This is Stratego with more restrictive/defined movement, and character powers.
1x d6 (3,4,5,6,7,8 faced)

Southern Rails — one of three titles in Winsome Games 2015 Essen Set — is played on a map of the Southeast United States and is similar in style to many of the stock-based, cube-rail games released by Winsome Games since 2007.

The game starts with the players spending two rounds selecting stocks from among six available companies. Each turn, a player must place a track cube from one of the companies in which he has stock. Once the tenth cube of a company is placed, the players score. Scores are based on the rail lines and awarded to players that own stock in the lines that meet certain criteria. Player order is reassigned and players get to select an additional stock. Players once again start placing cubes. This is repeated until the fourth scoring round, after which the game ends. The player with the most points wins.

1857 — one of three titles in Winsome Games 2015 Essen Set — is an 18xx game set in Argentina and requires some of the components from 1830 in order to play. There are 8 companies in the game with 6 unique privates. Several of these privates continue to function if owned by a railroad when they would normally close and removed from the game. Companies also have stations on the board from the beginning of the game that block passage through those locations, even before the company floats.

Trans-Siberian Railroad — one of three titles in Winsome Games 2015 Essen Set — shares some similarities with older Winsome titles where the rail network is already printed on the board and individual companies purchase the links that are printed.

There are six total companies in the game, though only four are available at the beginning. Once the initial stocks are auctioned, players take turns buying stock, building rails, or passing. Some actions cause the timing cube to move which in turns leads to dividend phases which is one of the end of game triggers. The two other companies become available during a later phase shift. The player with the most money at the end of the game wins.

item.description:
In Witkacy, you are going to restore copies of paintings by the famous polish artist Witkacy. In order to get the most of them, you need to look for the right fragments. The player who has the most copies restored wins, but at the same time, popular paintings are more valuable than others.

Each player starts with one double-sided card and puts it in front of themselves as the start of their collection. In each round players take one card, may play a special action, then add the card to their collection. Each card is divided in three segments and shows only part of a painting — at least one quarter of it, half at most.

The aim of the game is to choose which parts of the cards to connect and when and how use the special one-time actions.

item.description:
Checkers and chess are classics, but where is the modern twist? tak•tak is today's new two-player strategy board game. tak•tak has simple rules like checkers and the layered strategies of chess. The game uses the familiar grid and 'battlefield' board to allow players to "advance, stack, and attack" chips of matching colors and numbers. While learning to play is quick and easy, it takes a real strategist to win.

How does it play?
Players take turns moving their pieces across the board one space at a time, either straight ahead or diagonally, into the gray "war zone" with the goal of reaching the other player's safe zone.

Stack & Attack
While moving across the board, players may stack any of their pieces of the same number or color. These stacks can now move as one piece to get across the board faster. When players meet in the war zone they may attack their opponent's pieces by stacking on any that are the same color or number and absorb them into their own forward moving stack.

How to win?
Advance the highest numeric value of chips into your opponents safe zone and win tak•tak!

Apollo XIII tells the whole story of that mission through a card-driven game system. Follow the story and face all of the disasters that plagued that mission!

To ensure the survival of the crew and get them back to Earth, you need to work together in this cooperative game to manage each setback that the mission faces. Your team must coordinate their actions, or you will not finish the mission! Of course, if you want an even bigger challenge, you can try the optional "competitive mode" to see who is the best mission coordinator!

item.description:
Greatest of All Mountains is a competitive Mountain building card game for 2-5 players that can be played in 45-90 minutes. The game currently includes nearly 160 cards.

Each player represents a mountain which is vying for the title of Greatest of All Mountains. To achieve this, players must acquire the most victory points in the three phases of the game, using various abilities and events to gain an advantage over the other players.

In hopes of achieving the high honor of being named Greatest of All Mountains, each player must first form the terrain of their mountain. By adding slopes, lakes, cliffs and more to their mountain they craft the foundation of their strategy. Players may also compete to gain the all or nothing "Tallest Mountain" award for additional VP.

Next, players must build facilities on their terrain. This is where strategy becomes very important as the facilities built greatly effect how the next phase will play out. Build the best facilities on the faces of your mountain or choose to build sub-par facilities on your opponent's mountains.

Finally, each player must attract tourists to their mountain. The goal is to get tourists to your mountain's "Safe Zone" where they will be scored at the end of the game. Tourists frequently change hands, so players must employ a variety of strategies and abilities to make sure their tourists are safe from the other players.

item.description:
Turnpike is the game of highway mayhem. Life on the road means relying on quick wits, mad skills, and a bit of luck to get you there in one piece. Turnpike captures the rolling shark tank that is the modern highway system where complete strangers shamelessly screw each other over in an infuriating race that no one really wins — until now.

1. Players roll dice to move. The play actions are inter-weavable and open. Players may do the following in any order: 

 move their car
 play cards
 move a non-player car 
 add or subtract a car
 generally wreak ruin upon the road 




3. Every turn, players move non-player cars out of their way and into the path of opponents.

4. The cards give players movement bonuses, allow control over road traffic, and let them mess with other players.

5. The card types are: DRIVER, TRAFFIC, AGGRESSIVE, INSTANT.

6. The winner is the player to push through the traffic jam and get to the EXIT first.

The theme of OctoDice is based on Aquasphere, and the game mechanisms recall that board game. On your turn, you roll six dice (three white and three black); two dice (one white and one black) form an action. Every roll you must pick exactly two dice to take out (any colour). In the end you combine the six dice any way you want, no matter in which order you chose to take them out of your rolls beforehand. You can use only two actions on your turn. On your development sheet you enter the actions chosen for this turn and note your points. You can also decide to "expand your lab" which will give you bonus actions or points. Other players may pick any action combination from your dice roll to add to their sheet. Do not forget to fight Octopodes ;) The game ends when each player had 6 turns. Whoever has the most points in the end wins.

item.description:
Revolution is the key word, and the question is which side will prevail? Ducks or robots? Choose your side carefully because in the end it determines how many real points you've won!

RevoltaaA consists of a 66-card deck, with 7×0, 6×1, 5×2, 5×3, 5×4, and 5×5 cards in both ducks (red) and robots (blue). Each player starts with 11 cards in hand, and 11 cards are placed in a deck on the table. Each round, reveal the top card of the deck; each player then selects one card from hand and reveals them simultaneously. Whichever side - duck or robot — has the highest sum has won the round, and whoever has played the lowest card of this side wins these cards. (In a tie for lowest, the next lowest card of this side wins; if no cards of the winning side are unique, then the deck wins.) The winner stacks these cards and places a card of the winning side on top of this stack, then a new round begins.

As soon as a side has won four times, the game ends with this side being victorious. Each player scores one point for each stack in front of them that shows this side and one point for each card of this side still in hand. Whoever has the most points wins! (Alternatively, play a number of games equal to the number of players and sum your points over those games.)

RevoltaaA includes a "bananas" variant in which the face-down deck is not used and cards aren't played simultaneously. Instead one player leads a card face up, then each player lays down a card in turn, with the winner being chosen the same way and the first player breaking ties. The winner of one round leads the next, and points are scored as in the original game.

Svälta räv (literally "starve fox") is a traditional card game played in Scandinavia that is similar to War and Beggar My Neighbour but differs from both of those games and may not have quite the same reputation for interminableness.

A deck of standard cards is dealt evenly to the players, face down. Then, each player simultaneously turns up the topmost card in their pile, starting to build a face-up pile. If one or more of the cards turned up are in the same suit, the player with the highest card showing in that suit wins all the cards in those face-up piles (but not the piles currently showing any other suit), adding them to the bottom of their face-down pile. This procedure of turning up cards continues until all cards are held by a single player, who wins the game. A player who runs out of face-down cards flips over their face-up pile and continues playing, while a player with no cards whatsoever is (mercifully?) out of the game.

Warhammer: Age of Sigmar is a skirmish tabletop game for two or more players where you command several armies from a huge range that goes from Humans, Dwarves, High Elves, Undead Vampires, Orcs, Beastman and lots of races. This book provides you with all the rules you need to play, and guides you through collecting and painting your own army of Citadel miniatures.

Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

item.description:
This is a simple game base on the "Take That" mechanic. The goal is to be the last player with at least 1 tooth.

It can be played by 2 to 4 players. A typical game will last 15 to 20 minutes. Players age recommanded is 8 and up. Younger players can play too!

How to play:
Use a d8 to attack one or more opponent by placing 1 to 8 small bacteria on their teeth. Use a d6 to try to clean your teeth. 1 point to remove a small bacteria. 2 points to remove a large bacteria. 3 points to clean a decayed tooth.

If you cannot remove a small bacteria, flip the card and it becomes large. If you cannot remove a small bacteria, flip the card and it becomes large. If you cannot remove a large bacteria, remove all bacteria and flip the tooth card and it becomes decayed. If you cannot clean a decayed tooh, remove the card from the game.

You get lucky if you get a crowned tooth. Opponents must the attack with 6 points to remove it.

The thematic trick card game from the specially developed fantasy world "Peladia". Tactics and deduction skills are in demand! Rise of the Dragonhunter affords fast gameplay and long lasting playing inception.

2 playing modes:
1. Teamplay 2 vs 2
2. full competitive

Winner of one match is the one with the most victory points, but that doesn't mean that he will grab the most loot. The player who grabs the most loot wins the game. This can even be the one with the fewest victory points!

item.description:
The Coterie is a headless cooperative tabletop role-playing game where uncommon heroes are pitted against an unfamiliar enemy. Choose your path through dark dungeons while searching for your objectives. Find lost materials and gain favor with the town to upgrade your weapons and armor. Your choices, both small and large, will determine your campaign. Band together with your allies and name your own coterie!

Your Coterie is the last line of defense for the land. The heroes you know are gone. You must stand together, or die alone.

Game features:

 Tile placement system that builds as you play to eliminate setup times. Each game will be different from the last. 
 Terrain adds an additional layer of complexity and variation to the game. As regions are discovered, so are their terrains. Terrains are drawn randomly, and can vary each game with each region.
 Backgrounds and skills to mix and match anyway the players wish. Each combination creates a different style of play.
 Limited resources are available. Not everyone will be able to be the plate armor wearing, front-line tank. Choose your equipment to best compliment your background and skill!
 Lasting equipment upgrades for your weapons and/or armor. 
 Evolving enemies that gain strength depending on how they are defeated in combat.

Major's Raiders is a word forming game which may be played by two or more persons, preferable FOUR. It consists of four racks and 150 blocks marked with letters and symbols, each of which, has a particular usage in the game. This game a word building game similar to Scrabble, the winner is the one with the most words when no letter tiles are left is the winner. Unique to this game is the "flag" tile which allows words to be captured.
